title: Minister assures water to all irrigation projects in  Rayalaseema
content: For the first time in 25 years, we have released Krishna water into Srisailam in July. Similarly, plans are afoot to fill up Adavipalli reservoir with 3,850 cusecs of Krishna water through Handri Neeva canal, says Rama Naidu

title: Thrissur Rural police nab attempted murder accused from Gundlupet hideout
content: Acting on intelligence inputs, a special team tracked the accused to a secluded farmhouse in Shivapura, near Gundlupet, where they had been hiding for the past five days

title: Lokesh appeals to Telugu diaspora to invest in Andhra Pradesh and contribute to its growth
content: Participating in a meeting organised by the A.P. Non-Resident Telugu Society and A.P. Economic Development Board in Singapore, he promises necessary hand-holding to the Telugu entrepreneurs coming forward to partner with the government

title: PM’s visit set to boost tourism in Tiruchi region
content: Gangaikonda Cholapuram emerged as one of the top searched items online since the announcement was made about Prime Minister’s  visit to Brahadisvar Temple about two weeks ago

title: NMC guidelines on live broadcast of surgeries focus on patient welfare, ethical standards
content: Live broadcasts of surgeries should strictly serve educational purposes, and are not for commercial gain; surgeons should avoid glorification, and be responsible in adhering to professional and ethical standards, the guidelines state

title: TNSDMA, WRD issue alert along the banks of the Cauvery
content: In Tiruchi, washermen and other riverside residents have been directly warned and autorickshaws have been deployed to make announcements about the impending flood threat

title: Plea to shift Myanmar Kuki detainees from Imphal jail
content: The rights organisation seeks transfer of Myanmar nationals to prison facilities in Kuki-dominated districts within the State; urges release of detainees held beyond their sentence period

title: New cooperative policy centralises power and snatches rights of State governments, says Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: The farmers’ umbrella body alleges that the policy favours takeover of agriculture sector by corporate sector

title: Ahmedabad police rescues 39 children found in vulnerable conditions
content: Officials say the drive focuses on identifying children at risk and ensuring their immediate protection and steps will be taken for the children’s rehabilitation

title: Rich tributes paid to martyrs to mark Kargil Vijay Divas
content: Mayor Jyoti Patil lays a wreath at the Kargil memorial located in front of the Deputy Commissioner’s office in Dharwad

title: State Horticulture Mission-Kerala to establish Mushroom villages in 50 more locations
content: The scheme, Comprehensive Development of Mushroom Villages in Kerala, is aimed at the empowerment of rural women, income generation for farmers, nutritional security and spotlighting business opportunities in mushroom cultivation

title: Andhra Pradesh government offers final chance for unapproved layout regularisation under amended LRS
content: Applications open for 90 days from July 26; only plots with registered deeds before June 30, 2025, eligible for regularisation

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin discharged after therapeutic procedure
content: Doctors have advised the Chief Minister to resume his normal routine after three days of rest post-discharge

title: Five arrested for murdering elderly woman, robbery in Chittapur
content: Investigation revealed that the accused made an attempt to manipulate the crime scene to make the murder appear as natural death

title: Narcotic drug manufacturing facility raided in Mysuru
content: Four persons arrested; raid carried out by the Maharashtra police in coordination with the Mysuru City police

title: New campaign to help higher education institutions in Kerala get NAAC accreditation
content: Of the roughly 2,000 higher education institutions operating in the State, 334 have NAAC accreditation. The State Level Quality Assurance Cell’s initiative includes training programmes on the new accreditation framework

title: Efforts are on to get clearance for Mahadayi, says Bommai
content: MPs from the region, including Jagadish Shettar, P.C. Gaddigoudar, to meet the Union Minister for Environment, Forest and Climate Change

title: No Road To Her Village, Woman Gives Birth Before She Could Reach Hospital
content: In a village of Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district, a tribal woman, Preeti Rawat, gave birth not in a hospital bed but in an ambulance parked two kilometres away because there is no road to her village.

title: UP Woman Alleges Harassment By In-Laws, Husband In Video, Dies By Suicide
content: The wife of a police constable in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow died by suicide allegedly over harassment by her in-laws.

title: Spanish Teen Being Investigated Over Nude AI Images Of Classmates
content: Spanish police said Sunday they were investigating a 17-year-old on suspicion of using artificial intelligence to deepfake nude images of female classmates for sale.

title: 22-Year-Old Dies After Slashing Wrist, Jumping Of 3rd Floor Of House In Jaipur: Cops
content: A 22-year-old youth allegedly died by suicide after slashing his wrist and jumping off the third floor of his house in Jaipur's Harmara area, police said on Sunday.

title: Himachal Pradesh Suffers Losses Of Over Rs 1500 Crore During Ongoing Monsoon Season
content: Since the onset of monsoon in the state on June 20 till date, Himachal Pradesh has suffered losses of over Rs 1,500 crores, officials said on Sunday.

title: Delhi Man, 42, Kills Colleague For Refusing Loan, Dumps Body In Tank: Cops
content: A 42-year-old man was allegedly bludgeoned to death at a farmhouse in Chhattarpur by his colleague after he refused to lend him Rs 10,000, officials said on Sunday.

title: Russia Begins Monthly Direct Flights To North Korea Amid Ukraine Conflict
content: Russia on Sunday began direct commercial flights to North Korea, in a further sign of closer ties with its Asian ally helping its offensive in Ukraine.

title: Centre Flags Carcinogen Fears On Acidity Medicine Ranitidine, Orders Probe
content: The Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) has directed all state and union territory drug regulators to ensure manufacturers of Ranitidine -- a commonly used acidity medicine --monitor NDMA levels.

title: Tejashwi Yadav's "Can Review" Hint On Bihar Liquor Ban Ahead Of Polls
content: Bihar's ban on alcohol, imposed by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar nine years ago, could be up for review if the Grand Alliance comes to power. Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav dropped a broad hint on this today

title: Tata Consultancy Services, India's Largest IT Services Provider, To Cut 12,000 Jobs
content: India's largest IT services provider Tata Consultancy Services will reduce its workforce by 2 per cent in its 2026 financial year, primarily affecting middle and senior management, the company said on Sunday.

title: Video: Fliers Agitated Over IndiGo Take-Off Delay, Air Hostess Folds Hands
content: Chaotic scenes played out onboard an IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Varanasi last night after checks on the aircraft delayed take-off by two hours

title: Lingayats Of A Maharashtra Town Don't Have Burial Ground. So They Did This
content: Members of the Lingayat community in Maharashtra's Beed district alleged that they do not have a cremation ground for their dead. To put pressure on the government and press their demands, they brought a body to the municipal council office.

title: UP Man Hacks Parents, Sister With Axe In Triple Murder Shocker
content: A man allegedly killed his parents and sister with an axe, reportedly over a land dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur district. The accused fled the scene after the attack, and police have launched a manhunt to track him down.

title: Wildfires Threaten Turkey's Fourth-Largest City Forcing Evacuations
content: Wildfires that have engulfed Turkey for weeks threatened the country's fourth-largest city early Sunday, causing more than 1,500 people to flee their homes and leaving a firefighter dead.

title: PM Modi Praises Transformation Of Ex-Maoists Into Fish Farmers In Jharkhand
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday praised the remarkable transformation of former Maoists in Jharkhand's Gumla district who have traded violence for fish farming.

title: Bhubaneswar BJD Corporator Arrested In Rape Case, Suspended From Party
content: BJD corporator of Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) Amaresh Jena, was arrested from Balasore district on Sunday in connection with a rape case lodged against him in the state capital, police said.

title: Comparing Siddaramaiah To Mysuru Maharaja Is Far-Fetched: Ex-Royal BJP MP
content: BJP MP and titular Maharaja of Mysuru, Yaduveer Krishnadatta Chamaraja Wadiyar, has strongly objected to Yathindra Siddaramaiah's recent comparison of Siddaramaiah to a former Maharaja of the Mysore Kingdom.

title: 'Clerical Error' Turns Farmer Into 'Poorest In India' With Rs 3 Annual Income
content: Officials soon scrambled into action, and by July 25, a new certificate was issued, boosting the farmer's reported annual income to Rs 30,000, i.e., Rs 2,500 per month.

title: Two Hyderabad Teens Die By Suicide Within 5 Days
content: The deaths by suicide of two Class 10 students at a private school in Hyderabad, Sheikh Rizwan and K. Hansika, within days of each other, has raised disturbing questions.

title: UP Boy, 8, Electrocuted. He Went Near Transformer To Fetch Cricket Ball
content: A seven-year-old boy was electrocuted in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow when he came in contact with a transformer in his neighbourhood, the damaged gate to which had not been repaired despite repeated complaints by residents of the area.

title: In strife-torn Moreh, Myanmar children bring a sliver of hope
content: Border town in Manipur sees revival of limited trade and schooling as families cross from civil war-hit Myanmar

title: Srisailam temple authorities focus on beautification of Shikaram
content: Located 8-km from the main temple, Shikaram is a sacred spot at a height of 2,830 feet above the main sea level and is the highest peak of Srisailam, devotees throng this place for the panoramic view of the temple and river Krishna

title: Farmer on night vigil killed in attack by 16-member herd of wild elephants in Andhra Pradesh’s Chittoor district
content: Irate villagers stage a blockade on the Tirupati-Punganur Road along with the body of the victim, accusing the Forest Department of gross negligence and demanding that an action plan be evolved to put an end to the man-animal conflict in the western mandals of the district

title: Illegal surrogacy and baby-selling racket busted in Hyderabad; fertility clinic head among 10 arrested
content: Police investigation revealed that the owner of Universal Srushti Fertility Centres had been running an unauthorised surrogacy and baby-selling operation after shifting to IVF services since 1998.

title: Tamil Nadu’s Own Tax revenue increases 14.5% in Q1, FY2025-2026
content: It rises to ₹43,070.45 crore from ₹37,605.43 crore in the same period last year. SOTR constitutes 75.3% of Tamil Nadu’s total revenue receipts

title: Asmita Khelo India Women’s Cycling City League 2025 held in Mysuru
content: 73 women take part in the competition hosted by Silicon City International School and conducted by Mysuru District Amateur Cycling Association

title: Minister orders inquiry into Anakapalli DCHS and 21 medical staff for ‘dereliction of duties’
content: The hospital had been operating a canteen without valid licence and did not have proper documentation of the food being served to patients, according to an ACB report

title: Water release from Tungabhadra dam increased
content: The water level in the reservoir stands at 1,624.76 ft against the full reservoir level of 1,633.00 ft

title: Punjab’s rising debt raises concern amid claims of sound fiscal management
content: Experts point to unsustainable borrowing trends driven by populism; government says debt under control with proactive steps

title: People cautioned in view of further increase in outflow from Almatti dam
content: This follows high water discharge from the Koyna dam in Maharashtra due to heavy rainfall in the dam’s catchment area

title: Legacy of Chola dynasty provides road map for modern India, says PM Modi in Tamil Nadu
content: Prime Minister Modi announces Centre will erect statues of Chola emperors Rajaraja Chola and his son, Rajendra Chola I in Tamil Nadu

title: No let-up in rain in Kodagu, several houses damaged
content: Harangi reservoir outflow increased to 25,000 cusecs owing to heavy rain in the catchment area, say irrigation officials; IMD issues orange alert for Kodagu district

title: Government rejects Congress’ allegations about a ₹2.1 lakh crore organic cotton scam in Madhya Pradesh
content: “Stringent action has been taken against the cases of wilful violation and severe non-conformities of Certification Bodies with the NPOP standards,” the Ministry of Commerce and Industry statement said

title: Over 2,300 ration shops set up in the past four years, says Tamil Nadu government
content: An official release that lists the achievements in the Public Distribution System since 2021, recalls the distribution of assistance to people during the COVID-19 pandemic and natural disasters such torrential rain and floods, among others

title: PM Modi given a rousing reception in Tiruchi
content: BJP and alliance party workers, including those from the AIADMK and Tamizhar Desam Katchi, assembled at key junctions along the route and members of the public showered flower petals on the convoy

title: 6,000 philanthropists supporting P4 scheme in Vizianagaram: Municipal Commissioner
content: The initiative aims to connect affluent individuals with needy families through a transparent, community-driven model to eradicate poverty

title: Parvatipuram MLA seeks food processing units, infrastructure push in Manyam district
content: Bonela Vijaya Chandra meets Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu and Minister Nara Lokesh, proposes agro-based industries to benefit tribal farmers and calls for improved educational infrastructure to drive local development

title: Cumulative storage in major dams in Karnataka at 80% capacity owing to surge in inflow
content: Heavy rains in the catchment areas of the Cauvery and the Krishna basins have resulted in a cumulative storage of 715.6 tmc ft against the gross capacity of 895.62 tmc ft across major reservoirs in Karnataka.

title: CPI(M) pushes back against the ‘capital punishment’ controversy centred around late V.S.
content: The recent portrayal by two former CPI(M) insiders that the party had singled out Achuthanandan for harsh criticism during its 2015 State conference in Alappuzha, forcing the veteran to exit the venue in distress, sparked the dispute, which erupted, discomfitingly for the party, in the wake of the outpouring of public grief for the departed leader

title: Kerala’s broiler poultry sector faces sustainability crisis amid rising costs
content: Break-even price for producing one kg of chicken in the State has reached ₹93, underscoring the growing financial strain on poultry farmers

title: Independence Day 2025: Fort of Kittur, floral models of Chennamma and Sangolli Rayanna to attract visitors to Lalbagh flower show
content: Around the Glass House, 60 boards of 4 feet by 8 feet dimensions will be put up to narrate the story of Kittur kingdom, including its origin, famous rulers and its eventual decline.

title: Kerala’s 360 Degree Metabolic Centre offers early diagnosis and counselling under one roof
content: The metabolic centre at the new outpatient block of General Hospital, Alappuzha, brings together a wide range of services under one roof, including tests for diabetes, hypertension and cholesterol, as well as assessments of kidney function, diabetes-related complications affecting the eyes and feet, pulmonary function tests and diet counselling

title: Tara Murali made remarkable contributions to city planning and conservation
content: Tara fearlessly pursued public causes and challenged civic actions that she believed overlooked the greater good or were non-compliant with regulations.

title: Flavour of crafts from Eastern India at this year’s Independence Day ‘At Home’
content: The invitations have been made by contributions of artisans from these four states and curated by the National Institute of Design

title: Rains lead to closure of tourist spots in Nilgiris; Avalanche dam sluice gates opened
content: Power outages were also reported across many places in Udhagamandalam, Gudalur and Manjoor towns owing to the rains accompanied by heavy winds

title: 72-year-old farmer electrocuted in Kerala’s Palakkad
content: It is suspected that the farmer accidentally stepped on a broken power line on his farmland when he went to collect fallen coconuts

title: Haridwar stampede: Four of six killed in Mansa Devi temple tragedy from Uttar Pradesh
content: Two have been identified as Aarush (12) of Bareilly and Vicky (18) from Rampur. Two others, whose age has not been confirmed yet, included Vakil of Barabanki and Shanti from Budaun

title: Chandrababu Naidu encouraging north Andhra leaders to get coveted posts: Telugu Desam Party
content: Gedela Srinubabu said elevation of former Union Minister P. Ashok Gajapathi Raju as Goa Governor and Srikakulam MP K. Rammohan Naidu as the Union Minister for Civil Aviation indicated the party had extended its wholehearted support to leaders of backward districts

title: PM Modi praises Mani Maran of Saraswathi Mahal Library for preserving ancient manuscripts
content: PM Modi said in every era of the country, there have been people who have dedicated their lives to this cause, and one such inspiring personality was Manimaran from Tamil Nadu’s Thanjavur.

title: Stampede at Haridwar temple failure of system: AAP
content: This is not just an accident, but a failure of the system, and accountability should be fixed, says AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal

title: Jharkhand High Court delivers verdicts pending for years within a week after death row convicts moves SC
content: On July 14, the top court agreed to examine the plea of the convicts and sought a response from the State government and the High Court within a week

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy to visit Nellore on July 31
content: Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy to visit SPSR Nellore district, offering support to arrested leaders and boosting party morale

title: Former Speaker Sakthan assumes temporary charge as Thiruvananthapuram DCC president after Palode Ravi resigned over “political gaffe”
content: Palode Ravi had resigned from the post after he came under fire from within the Congress for supposedly broadcasting a defeatist outlook on Congress’ prospects in the upcoming local body elections and the 2026 Assembly polls

title: 'Clerical error' turns M.P. farmer into 'poorest man in India'; income certificate goes viral
content: Officials soon scrambled into action, and by July 25, a new certificate was issued, boosting the farmer's reported annual income to ₹30,000, i.e., ₹2,500 per month.

title: Woman drives car into ditch while using Google Maps for directions; rescued
content: The incident took place at around 1 a.m. on Friday (July 25, 2025)in Belapur area of Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai township

title: Naidu’s Singapore visit strengthens investment prospects for Andhra Pradesh
content: The discussions centered on transformative opportunities across sectors such as defence, electronics, aerospace, green energy, and quantum technologies

title: Raj Thackeray drives to Matoshree to greet Uddhav on his birthday
content: Raj Thackeray drove from his residence Shivteerth in Dadar to Matoshree, Uddhav Thackeray’s residence in Bandra.

title: Parliament Monsoon session: After first week washout, Houses set for fiery debate on Pahalgam attack, Operation Sindoor
content: Both the government and Opposition have consented to a marathon 16-hour debate in each House, which invariably stretches longer in practice.

title: BJD corporator arrested in rape case, suspended from party
content: A senior officer said that Jena was staying in a village in Nilgiri area, which is close to the forest, with the aim of escaping to the jungle if there was any police raid to apprehend him

title: McLaurin at camp, on PUP list with ankle injury
content: Commanders receiver Terry McLaurin arrived at training camp Sunday without a new deal and was placed on the physically unable to perform list with an ankle injury.

title: Rodgers on Bradshaw barbs: He doesn't know me
content: Aaron Rodgers said he'd like to get to know Terry Bradshaw on "a deeper level" after the Steelers legend ripped his former team's pursuit of the future Hall of Fame quarterback.

title: Sources: Donovan agrees to extension with Bulls
content: Chicago Bulls coach Billy Donovan has signed a multiyear contract extension with the franchise, sources told ESPN on Sunday.

title: Cowboys sign TE Ferguson to 4-year extension
content: The Cowboys signed tight end Jake Ferguson to a four-year, $52 million extension that includes $30 million in guaranteed money.

title: Dolphins, Fitzpatrick agree to reworked contract
content: The Dolphins have agreed to a reworked contract with safety Minkah Fitzpatrick, which adds a $16.435 million signing bonus, a source told Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: Zayas, 22, becomes youngest current world champ
content: On Saturday night in New York City, Xander Zayas, 22, became the youngest current world champion by capturing the vacant WBO junior middleweight title with a dominant decision win over Jorge Garcia Perez at the Theater at Madison Square Garden.

title: 12-year-old debuts at world swim championships
content: The globe got its first look on Sunday at 12-year-old Chinese prodigy swimmer Yu Zidi, making her debut at the swimming world championships.

title: Judge placed on IL, but 'it could've been worse'
content: Yankees star Aaron Judge was placed on the IL with a flexor strain in his right elbow, but a scan did not show damage in the two-time MVP's ulnar collateral ligament.

title: 🏈 Iconic alternate CFB uniforms of past 25 years
content: We handed out nominations to some of the best, worst and wildest alternate uniforms donned by college football teams over the past quarter century.

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Euro 2025 final preview: England vs. Spain, tactics, players, prediction
content: England and Spain have done this before: The Euro 2025 final is a rerun of the final from the 2023 World Cup, so we're in familiar territory.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Bubble teams could shape week ahead
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Ibrahimovic, Messi, Gerrard: The 10 best and 10 worst DPs in MLS history
content: With the MLS transfer window opening Thursday, ESPN looks back at some of the best and worst big-money signings in league history.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City, Man United target Donnarumma moves closer to PSG exit
content: Man City and Man United are ready to move for Donnarumma as PSG have identified his replacement. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Uddhav-Raj bonhomie: Inside Thackeray political reset - desperate photo-op or strategic comeback?
content: The Thackeray cousins, Uddhav and Raj, are exploring a reunion amidst shifting political dynamics in Maharashtra, particularly with the upcoming BMC elections. Both leaders, facing challenges to their political relevance, aim to consolidate their support base. This alliance could reshape the political landscape, especially with a weakened Shinde faction and potential realignments within the NDA.

title: 'World understands power': Bhagwat on why India must be 'strong and wealthy'
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasized India's need to become powerful and economically strong to gain global respect, advocating for the preservation of national identity by using "Bharat" without translation. He highlighted that true education should promote sacrifice and societal contribution, extending beyond schooling to encompass the home and community environment. Bhagwat urged focus on raising responsible future generations.

title: Will the August 1 deadline be extended by Trump? What Commerce Secretary said
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced that President Trump's reciprocal tariff deadline of August 1, 2025, will not be extended. These tariffs will be implemented, with Customs beginning to collect revenue.

title: Explained: What are new porn rules in UK and that have led to 500%-plus jump in VPN
content: The UK's stringent new age verification laws for online pornography, aimed at protecting minors, have triggered a massive surge in VPN usage as users seek to bypass the restrictions. These regulations require adult content websites to implement robust age checks, leading to privacy concerns and industry pushback.

title: Chess | Women's WC final: Humpy, Divya head to tie-break after Game 2 draw
content: The FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 final between GM Koneru Humpy and IM Divya Deshmukh remains undecided after a second draw in their classical match in Batumi. The tense encounter saw a cautious game, leading to a repetition of moves and a stalemate. The title will now be determined in Monday's rapid tie-breaks, pitting Humpy's experience against Divya's youthful talent.

title: Mark Zuckerberg appoints ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist for Meta's AI lab
content: Mark Zuckerberg has announced Shengjia Zhao as the chief scientist of Meta Superintelligence Labs. Zhao co-created ChatGPT. He also played a key role in developing GPT-4. Meta has invested heavily in AI talent acquisition. The company has hired talents from Google, OpenAI, Apple and Anthropic. Meta will also spend billions on AI data centers in the US.

title: 'Matter of happiness': Fadnavis says 'nothing political' in Raj's Matoshree visit
content: Devendra Fadnavis downplayed any political implications of Raj Thackeray's visit to Uddhav Thackeray's residence, Matoshree, for his birthday, emphasising it as a gesture of goodwill. However, the meeting, following their joint opposition to Hindi as a medium of instruction, fuels speculation of a potential MNS-Shiv Sena (UBT) alliance for the upcoming local body elections.

title: One hour of Stokes in Manchester: One shoulder, one spell, one statement
content: Ben Stokes delivered a stirring eight-over spell on Day 5 at Old Trafford, breaking a key Indian partnership and pushing through visible pain. With his shoulder aching and hamstring tight, Stokes's relentless intensity and tactical brilliance kept England in the game, reaffirming his reputation as one of the sport’s ultimate warriors.

title: Travis Kelce vs NFL: Swift-style celebration flagged as threat; league crackdown looms
content: NFL star Travis Kelce faces potential fines for his signature "bow and arrow" touchdown celebration, a move recently imitated by his girlfriend, Taylor Swift, during her London concert. The NFL prohibits gestures resembling weapons, and Kelce's celebration falls under scrutiny. Several players, including Patrick Mahomes, have previously been fined for similar actions.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, now holds stock valued at…
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: SIR in Bihar: INDIA bloc slams ‘institutional arrogance’, says NDA allies also hit – Key points
content: The INDIA bloc has strongly criticized the Election Commission's ongoing voter deletion process, citing opacity and flawed data. They allege that over 63 lakh voters are at risk of disenfranchisement due to inconsistencies in the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise. The opposition demands an immediate halt, warning of the potential exclusion of nearly 2 crore people and threatening democratic participation.

title: Patrick Mahomes Sr. vs travel ban: Court clears trip to support son; Chiefs’ Arizona clash looms
content: Patrick Mahomes Sr., facing probation for a felony DWI charge, has received court approval to travel from Texas to Arizona. He plans to attend the Kansas City Chiefs' preseason game against the Arizona Cardinals on August 9, 2025, in Glendale. A Smith County judge granted the request, allowing Mahomes Sr. to support his son, Patrick Mahomes, at the game.

title: CRPF commandos to return to Libya; will secure Indian embassy in Tripoli
content: The Central Reserve Police Force will soon send commandos to Tripoli. They will protect the Indian embassy there. The embassy had reopened last July after being closed for five years. This closure was due to civil unrest. A team of 40 commandos will be led by a deputy commandant. The Ministry of External Affairs will issue clearances.

title: Ladki Bahin scheme: 14k men got benefits, claims Sule; Ajit says will recover money if true
content: Supriya Sule alleged that approximately 14,000 men improperly benefited from the Mukhyamantri Mazhi Ladki Bahin scheme, demanding a CBI investigation into the enrollment process. Ajit Pawar responded that funds would be recovered from ineligible male beneficiaries, with strict action taken if necessary. Aditi Tatkare stated that benefits for 26.34 lakh ineligible beneficiaries, including men, have been temporarily suspended pending review.

title: Gill equals Sunil Gavaskar and Don Bradman, leaves Virat Kohli behind
content: Shubman Gill etched his name in cricket history on Day 5 at Old Trafford, scoring his fourth century of the series against England. He joins Bradman and Gavaskar as the only captains to achieve this feat in a single series.

title: Tua Tagovailoa vs Tyreek Hill: Rift bombshell drops; locker room fractures emerge
content: Tua Tagovailoa is publicly addressing tension with Tyreek Hill, emphasizing accountability and leadership beyond on-field performance. Hill's past remarks about leaving Miami raised concerns, prompting Tagovailoa to demand better locker room conduct. This internal challenge could either unite the Dolphins or expose deeper divisions as they pursue a playoff breakthrough in the upcoming season.

title: Top 5 entertainment news of the day
content: Entertainment is buzzing with heartwarming moments and strong opinions! RJ Mahvash surprised Yuzvendra Chahal with a dreamy London birthday celebration. An unseen photo from Vamika's birthday went viral, showcasing Virat and Anushka's intimate family time. Tanushree Dutta slammed trolls criticizing her dietary choices. Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas enjoyed BLACKPINK's concert, singing along to their daughter's favorite song.

title: TCS plans 2% workforce cut over the year; what you should know
content: Tata Consultancy Services plans to reduce its workforce by approximately 2%, impacting over 12,000 employees due to economic uncertainties and AI-driven technological changes. The company will provide affected staff with severance benefits, outplacement services, and extended insurance coverage.

title: IND vs ENG 4th Test: Shubman Gill scripts history becomes first-ever to...
content: Shubman Gill made history at Old Trafford, becoming the first Asian batter to surpass 700 runs in a Test series in England. His consistent performance, including four half-centuries and two centuries, has been crucial for India.

title: PK-Chirag deal? Pappu Yadav 'connects dots'; asks Prashant Kishore to name CM face
content: Amid concerns over Bihar's law and order, Pappu Yadav alleged a coalition between Chirag Paswan and Prashant Kishore for the upcoming elections, urging Kishore to declare Paswan as the chief ministerial candidate. Paswan expressed his shame over the uncontrolled crime, triggering reactions from alliance partners.

title: Winnie Harlow stuns in sultry birthday pics as she celebrates turning 31
content: Winnie Harlow, the supermodel and entrepreneur, celebrated her 31st birthday following her engagement to NBA player Kyle Kuzma in February 2025. The couple's relationship began on Instagram and blossomed after Harlow moved to Los Angeles. Kuzma proposed during a romantic Caribbean getaway, surprising Harlow with a heartfelt poem and an 8.5-carat engagement ring.

title: IND vs ENG: Painful for Gill! India skipper takes nasty blow from Stokes - Watch
content: Shubman Gill faced a harrowing moment during the fourth Test against England when a sharp, rising delivery from Ben Stokes struck his helmet. Despite the painful blow, which required immediate medical attention, Gill bravely resumed batting. He continued to anchor India's innings alongside Washington Sundar, demonstrating resilience after early setbacks and keeping India in the hunt.

title: What’s in a name? 22 days in jail and a 17-year legal battle
content: Rajveer Singh Yadav was wrongly arrested due to a clerical error that swapped his name with his brother's, leading to a 17-year legal battle. Despite police admitting the mistake early on, the case dragged through the courts, devastating Rajveer's life and his family's well-being. A Mainpuri court has finally acquitted him, ordering action against the negligent officers responsible for his suffering and lost opportunities.

title: Raj Thackeray enters 'Matoshree' after 13 yrs to greet Uddhav on birthday
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray visited Uddhav Thackeray to wish him a happy 65th birthday, weeks after their joint rally where they embraced, signaling a moment of unity. Uddhav also received greetings from INDIA bloc allies, including Rahul Gandhi and MK Stalin, who praised his stance on linguistic identity. The leaders had previously united at the 'Awaz Marathicha' rally.

title: 'Conducted in a manner that ... ': Even the dead are filling up Bihar SIR forms, SC told
content: Petitioners have accused the Election Commission of India of conducting Bihar's electoral roll revision in a fraudulent manner. Allegations include BLOs forging signatures, submitting forms for deceased individuals, and voters being enrolled without their knowledge or consent. Concerns are raised about transparency, accountability, and potential disenfranchisement, especially with the demand for citizenship proof for voter enrollment.

title: From tunnel to Turkey: How Hamas leader Sinwar’s widow escaped and remarried
content: Reports suggest Yahya Sinwar's widow, Samar Abu Zamer, entered Hamas tunnels with children and later fled to Turkey using a fake passport. This evacuation of high-ranking Hamas officials' families, facilitated by falsified documents and external support, has fueled resentment among Gazan residents facing dire conditions. While some leaders' families have reportedly left, others remain, highlighting a growing divide in commitment.

title: A beginning but with caution: Sitharaman hints at easing India-China economic ties
content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman indicated a potential thaw in India-China business relations, citing mutual interest in reviving economic engagement after years of tension. Following S Jaishankar's visit, both nations are exploring avenues for increased interaction and potential easing of investment restrictions. While cautious optimism prevails, progress is also noted in bilateral trade talks with the US and EU.

title: Russian railway power hit: Ukrainian attack delays trains; 99 drones downed
content: Ukrainian drones, intercepted by Russian air defenses over the Volgograd region, caused damage to railway power lines, disrupting train services. The incident prompted the temporary suspension of flight operations at Volgograd Airport. While no injuries were reported, the attacks are part of Ukraine's retaliation against Russia's aggression, targeting infrastructure critical to its war efforts.

title: Eastern Congo: Islamic State-backed group attacks church; 21 killed
content: A tragic incident occurred in eastern Congo. Islamic State-backed rebels attacked a church. The attack resulted in the death of at least 21 people. The Allied Democratic Force is suspected of carrying out the assault. Several houses and shops were also set ablaze during the violence. The Congolese army has confirmed the incident and a lower death toll.

title: ‘Power line fell on crowd’: What triggered stampede at Haridwar temple; 8 dead
content: Tragedy struck at the Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar, where a stampede claimed the lives of at least six people. The incident occurred amidst a large gathering of devotees. District Magistrate Mayur Dixit confirmed the fatalities, while Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed his condolences and assured full support.

title: Thane woman poisons 3 minor daughters to death
content: In Maharashtra's Thane district, a 27-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly poisoning her three young daughters due to distress over domestic issues. Sandhya Sandeep Bere reportedly mixed pesticide in a rice and lentil dish, leading to the girls' hospitalization and subsequent deaths. Autopsy reports confirmed the presence of poison, prompting a murder case and her arrest.

title: Actor Madhampatty Rangaraj marries stylist Joy Crizildaa again; announces pregnancy
content: Actor Madhampatty Rangaraj, known for 'Mehandi Circus' and 'Cooku with Comali,' has remarried celebrity stylist Joy Crizildaa, who announced they are expecting a child in 2025. The announcement has sparked controversy due to Rangaraj's existing marriage, as his first wife, Shruthi Rangaraj, maintains they are still married, creating public attention and speculation.

title: Russian navy parade: Kremlin cancels annual event; cites security reasons
content: Russia has cancelled its annual Navy Day parade, citing security concerns amid heightened tensions and increased Ukrainian strikes on Russian naval assets since the 2022 invasion. The parade, traditionally held in St. Petersburg, is a significant event showcasing Russia's naval power and geopolitical presence, often attended by high-ranking officials and President Putin.

title: MP horror: Woman raped repeatedly on pretext of 'exorcism' in Rewa
content: In Rewa district, a 32-year-old woman was allegedly raped multiple times by a close relative under the guise of exorcism. The accused, a 45-year-old man, reportedly filmed the initial assault and later repeated the act, threatening her into silence.

title: Israel intercepts aid boat on way to Gaza; 'kidnaps' 19 activists, 2 journalists
content: Israeli forces intercepted the 'Handala,' a vessel from the Freedom Flotilla Coalition, aiming to breach Gaza's maritime blockade. The boat, carrying 19 activists and journalists, was seized in international waters and escorted to Ashdod Port. The coalition claims the crew has been "kidnapped," while Israel defends its actions, citing security concerns and calling the attempt unlawful.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ BO collection day 10 (Live): Mohit Suri’s film eyes Rs 250 crore mark
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' is performing well, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda. The movie has earned over Rs 235 crore. It is moving towards the Rs 250 crore mark. 'Saiyaara' has surpassed 'Housefull 5', becoming the second-highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025. Critics have praised the film's emotional story, music, and performances.

title: Mumbai bizman jailed for kissing bank officer; gets 1-year RI, Rs 1k fine
content: A Mumbai businessman, Narendra Sagvekar, has been sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment for outraging the modesty of a female bank employee. The incident occurred during an address verification visit to Sagvekar's residence. The magistrate's court found the woman's testimony credible, despite defense arguments of a false complaint.

title: India signs up for 3-day UN meet for peaceful Palestine
content: India is set to participate in the UN high-level conference addressing the Palestine question and the two-state solution, co-chaired by France and Saudi Arabia. Despite US warnings against participation, India hopes the conference will pave the way for concrete steps towards a two-state solution, advocating for an immediate ceasefire and hostage release.

title: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce baby name revelation: Missouri newborn named “Kelce Taylor”
content: In a heartwarming tribute to Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, a newborn girl has been named Kelce Taylor at Liberty Hospital in Missouri. Born on July 25, 2025, the baby was welcomed as "the youngest Swiftie," adorned in a Kelce jersey. This unique name reflects the couple's significant impact on their fans, blending the worlds of pop music and football.

title: After Chirag's Bihar crime remarks, RDJ asks why he is in alliance with Nitish govt
content: Following Union Minister Chirag Paswan's criticism of Bihar's rising crime rates, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) accused him of hypocrisy. RJD MP Manoj Jha urged Paswan, citing his close ties with Prime Minister Modi, to request a fact-finding team to assess Bihar's law and order.
